IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AN INDEPENDENT PRE-K TO GRADE 8 JEWISH DAY SCHOOL SERVING THE WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL'S MISSION IS TO DELIVER A JOYFUL, INNOVATIVE EDUCATION THAT EMPOWERS OUR CHILDREN TO BECOME ACCOMPLISHED LEARNERS AND COMPASSIONATE UPSTANDERS WHO ARE COMMITTED TO JEWISH LIFE AND TO CREATING A BETTER WORLD.
IRS990.Desc: COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL IS A NURTURING, ACADEMICALLY EXCELLENT JEWISH DAY SCHOOL FOR THE 21ST CENTURY. FROM OUR EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAM THROUGH MIDDLE SCHOOL, WE INSPIRE OUR STUDENTS TO LOVE LEARNING THROUGH INNOVATIVE TEACHING METHODS AND HANDS-ON DISCOVERY. CDS IS A WELCOMING COMMUNITY WHERE PITTSBURGH FAMILIES WHO SPAN THE SPECTRUM OF JEWISH BELIEF AND PRACTICE CAN LEARN AND CONNECT ALONG WITH THEIR CHILDREN. AS OUR STUDENTS GROW IN KNOWLEDGE FROM PRESCHOOL THROUGH 8TH GRADE, THEY GROW AS PEOPLE-FINDING THEIR PASSIONS, EMBRACING THEIR JEWISH IDENTITIES, AND PREPARING FOR SUCCESSFUL AND MEANINGFUL LIVES. THERE WERE 281 STUDENTS ENROLLED DURING THE 2017-2018 SCHOOL YEAR IN EARLY CHILDHOOD THROUGH GRADE 8.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF VARIOUS INVESTMENT FUNDS ESTABLISHED PRIMARILY FOR SCHOLARSHIP, CAPITAL REPAIR AND PROGRAM AND OPERATING EXPENSES OF COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL.

COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL IS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC); THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS NECESSARY. THE CODIFICATION TOPIC INCOME TAXES PRESCRIBES A MINIMUM RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT METHODOLOGY THAT A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN IS REQUIRED TO MEET BEFORE BEING RECOGNIZED IN FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL CLASSIFIES INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS INCOME TAX EXPENSE, IF INCURRED. COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL'S STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION AT JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017 DO NOT INCLUDE ANY LIABILITIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS; FURTHER, COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL HAS NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS. COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL BELIEVES THAT IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION OF ITS TAX RETURNS FOR YEARS BEFORE 2015.
THE POLICY IS PUBLISHED IN A LOCAL NEWSPAPER ANNUALLY.

MONETARY GRANTS WERE RECEIVED FROM FUNDS RELATED TO THE PENNSYLVANIA EDUCATIONAL IMPROVEMENT TAX PROGRAM. THESE FUNDS PROVIDE TUITION ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE SCHOOL. STATE FUNDING IS PROVIDED FOR TEXTBOOKS, SUPPLIES, AND SERVICES FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING THE SCHOOL.

TUITION ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ANALYSIS OF COMPLETED APPLICATION FORMS, AND COPIES OF TAX RETURNS. THE PROCESS IS OVERSEEN BY A CONFIDENTIAL TUITION ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE, CHAIRED BY THE CONTROLLER, WITH PROCESSING OF APPLICATIONS BY AN UNRELATED THIRD PARTY.
EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION IS COMPARED TO BENCHMARK DATA ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE BOARD COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE TO THE COMPENSATION ANNUALLY.
THE AMOUNT IN COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND MAY EXERCISE, DURING THE INTERVALS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, ALL OF THE POWERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. IT SHALL ALSO BE THE DUTY OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO SET THE AGENDA FOR EACH MEETING OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES; TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WITH RESPECT TO THE OPERATIONS OF THE SCHOOL BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD; AND TO ENGAGE IN STRATEGIC PLANNING REGARDING THE LONG-RANGE NEEDS OF THE SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER OVERSEES THE COMPLETION OF THE 990 AND SUBMITS IT TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. THE 990 IS THEN SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS, THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORMS AND MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION IS COMPARED TO BENCHMARK DATA ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. CHANGES ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENTS OR BUDGETED COST OF LIVING INCREASES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMMUNITY DAY SCHOOL MAKES ITS GOVERNANCE DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XII, QUESTION 2C, OVERSIGHT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE SOLICITS BIDS FROM INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS TO COMPLETE THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTS THE AUDITOR. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND MEETS WITH THE AUDITORS TO DISCUSS THE RESULTS OF THE AUDIT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
